rows.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.
By the Star when it setteth,
Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;
rows.transliteration: mā ḍalla ṣāḥibukum wa mā ghawā

rows.translation: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.
It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired,
Which one of mighty powers hath taught him,
One vigorous; and he grew clear to view
When he was on the uppermost horizon.
Then he drew nigh and came down
Till he was (distant) two bows' length or even nearer,
And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.
The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.
Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth?
And verily he saw him yet another time
By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,
Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode.
When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree,
The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.
rows.transliteration: mā zāghal baṣaru wa mā ṭaghā

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ رَأَىٰ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِ ٱلْكُبْرَىٰٓ
rows.translation: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.
rows.transliteration: laqad ra-ā min āyāti rabbihil kubrā

rows.translation: Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza
And Manat, the third, the other?
Are yours the males and His the females?
That indeed were an unfair division!

rows.arabic: إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّآ أَسْمَآءٌ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهْوَى ٱلْأَنفُسُ ۖ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلْهُدَىٰٓ
rows.translation: They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they) themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them.
rows.transliteration: in hiya illā asmā-un sammaytumūhā antum wa-ābā-ukum mā anzalallāhu bihā min sulṭān ۚ in yattabi`ūna illaẓ ẓanna wa mā tahwal-anfus ۖ walaqad jā-ahum min rabbihimul hudā

rows.translation: Or shall man have what he coveteth?
But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former.

rows.arabic: وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغْنِى شَفَـٰعَتُهُمْ شَيْـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَن يَأْذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرْضَىٰٓ
rows.translation: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.
rows.transliteration: wakam min malakin fis samāwāti lā tughnī shafā`atuhum shay-an illā min ba`di an ya-dhanallāhu liman yashā-u wayarḍā

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ تَسْمِيَةَ ٱلْأُنثَىٰ
rows.translation: Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the names of females.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati layusammūnal malā-ikata tasmiyatal-unthā

rows.arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنْ عِلْمٍ ۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ ۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغْنِى مِنَ ٱلْحَقِّ شَيْـًٔا
rows.translation: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.
rows.transliteration: wa mā lahum bihi min `il-m ۖ in yattabi`ūna illaẓ ẓann ۖ wa innaẓ ẓanna lā yughnī minal ḥaqqi shay-ā

rows.arabic: فَأَعْرِضْ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكْرِنَا وَلَمْ يُرِدْ إِلَّا ٱلْحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنْيَا
rows.translation: Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance and desireth but the life of the world.
rows.transliteration: fa-a`riḍ `an man tawallā `an dhikrinā walam yurid illal-ḥayātad dunyā

rows.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبْلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْعِلْمِ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ
rows.translation: Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right.
rows.transliteration: dhālika mablaghuhum minal `il-m ۚ inna rabbaka huwa a`lamu biman ḍalla `an sabīlihi wahuwa a`lamu bimanih-tadā

rows.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ لِيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَـٰٓـُٔوا۟ بِمَا عَمِلُوا۟ وَيَجْزِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحْسَنُوا۟ بِٱلْحُسْنَى
rows.translation: And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and reward those who do good with goodness.
rows.transliteration: walillāhi mā fis samāwāti wa mā fil-arḍi liyajziyal ladhīna asā-ū bimā `amilū wayajziyal ladhīna aḥsanū bil ḥusnā

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجْتَنِبُونَ كَبَـٰٓئِرَ ٱلْإِثْمِ وَٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَ ۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلْمَغْفِرَةِ ۚ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِكُمْ إِذْ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَإِذْ أَنتُمْ أَجِنَّةٌ فِى بُطُونِ أُمَّهَـٰتِكُمْ ۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓا۟ أَنفُسَكُمْ ۖ هُوَ أَعْلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ
rows.translation: Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him who wardeth off (evil).
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yajtanibūna kabā-iral-ithmi wal fawāḥisha illallamam ۚ inna rabbaka wāsi`ul maghfirah ۚ huwa a`lamu bikum idh ansha-akum minal-arḍi wa idh antum ajinnatun fī buṭūni ummahātikum ۖ falā tuzakkū anfusakum ۖ huwa a`lamu bimanit-taqā

rows.translation: Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away,
And gave a little, then was grudging?
Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth?

rows.arabic: أَمْ لَمْ يُنَبَّأْ بِمَا فِى صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ
rows.translation: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses
rows.transliteration: am lam yunabba-bimā fī ṣuḥufi mūsā

rows.translation: And Abraham who paid his debt:
That no laden one shall bear another's load,

rows.arabic: وَأَن لَّيْسَ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ
rows.translation: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,
rows.transliteration: wa-an laysa lilinsāni illā mā sa`ā

rows.translation: And that his effort will be seen.
And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment;
And that thy Lord, He is the goal;
And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,
And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;
And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,
From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth;
And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;
And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;
And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;
And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A'ad,
And (the tribe of) Thamud He spared not;

rows.arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ مِّن قَبْلُ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ هُمْ أَظْلَمَ وَأَطْغَىٰ
rows.translation: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;
rows.transliteration: waqawma nūḥin min qabl ۖ innahum kānū hum aẓlama wa-aṭghā

rows.translation: And Al-Mu'tafikah He destroyed
So that there covered them that which did cover.
Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute?
This is a warner of the warners of old.
The threatened Hour is nigh.

rows.arabic: لَيْسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ
rows.translation: None beside Allah can disclose it.
Marvel ye then at this statement,
And laugh and not weep,
While ye amuse yourselves?
Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him.
